Rule.Title: Use PascalCase for public or internal fields.
Specify access modifiers for all members.
Place 'using' directives at the top of the file.
Separate member definitions with a single blank line.
Place the opening brace on a new line.
Use 'var' for local variables when the type is obvious.
Use explicit type names when the type is not apparent.
Use expression-bodied members for simple methods and properties.
Use properties instead of public fields.
Use 'readonly' for fields and properties initialized only in the constructor.
Use 'is' and 'as' for safe type checking and casting.
